32189.name: {yCommon Room {*at {yW{*yler's {yB{*ell{x
description: This large second floor room at Nat Wyler's Bell smells
even worse than the one below.  Too many drunks must have
staggered up the stairs,  passing out on one of the linen
cots lining the far wall. Some of them likely have lost a
meal or two here, leaving a sweetly acidic smell of vomit
on the floor and furniture.   Dying embers smolder in the
small brick fireplace, before which rest a couple chairs,
threadbare foot rests at their feet.  The carpet spanning
most of the room may have once been quite fine, something
from a far off land perhaps, but now the colors are faded
and it bears large amorphous stains.  This might not be a
pleasant place to sleep, but in a pinch, it'll do.

32163.name: Office of the Head of Industrial Affairs

description: -=) Phlannarian Pets (=-

32159.name: Office of the Head of Domestic Affairs

32141.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: The smell of salt air drifts in from the south where this
cobblestone street leads out toward the docks bordering the
{CB{cay{x of {CP{chlan{x.  The effect is amplified by the smell of fish
freshly fried wafting from the old building to the east.  A
wooden sign hangs above the door bearing a faded shortsword
and the barely legible words The {BB{cit{wte{Wr {wBl{cad{Be{x.  A couple of
windows look in on City Hall to the west,  revealing little
more than blandly colored curtains.  During daylight hours,
people pass through the large open area to the north buying
and selling wares of all variety at the city's {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x.

32132.name: {yN{wortheast {yC{worner {xof the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x
description: Bordered to the east by {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x and by more stalls
in most other directions, this corner of the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x swims
with activity.  Vendors and patrons of all shapes, sizes,
and ethnicities sell and buy wares of every color, shape,
and substance.  The sound of metal pounding against metal
can often be heard to the north,  ringing from the famous
forge of {RM{wa{Wth{we{*o{x, renowned weaponsmith. The quality of his
weaponry is beyond compare and attracts buyers from round
the Moonsea region. Across the road to the east is a shop
with paned windows.  The sign above its door has a rather
odd {Mw{minged {Mc{mat{x painted upon it.

32188.name: Flying Cat Storage Room
description: Wow!  Even more cats!  This place is just overflowing.
HEY!  What are you doing in here?

32169.name: Office of the Head of Priest Affairs

32136.name: {yS{wouthwest {yC{worner {xof the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x
description: Wandering the labyrinth of vendors and stalls, one might
end up in this darkest corner of the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x.  The shadiest
individuals come to deal with the greediest merchants here
where the eye of the law seems to remain only half open. A
few of the dealers may seem reputable, their wares perhaps
of finer quality than most,  but their prices are also the
highest by far.   Pressed to the {BC{bity {BH{ball{x building to the
south, a perfect irony exists here: corruption right under
the very seat of justice.  Still,  one can hardly help but
browse the strange goods sold here, eyeing the merchandise
as one is eyed by the bazaar's regulars.  To the west is a
rather small, battered building, a sign bearing a bell and
the words {yN{*at {yW{*yler's {yB{*ell{x swinging above its door.

32175.name: {WP{*ortmaster's {WO{*ffice{x
description: This little building seems little more than a large mess
of paperwork and crates.  There does seem to be some small
amount of organization, however.  A sign on the south wall
reads Shipping, while a sign to the north reads Receiving.
Most of the crates are sealed shut and arranged by company
or transport ship. Some of the crates are opened as clerks
sort and inventory the contents. A long desk sits amid the
mess, covered in its own cluttered:  a large assortment of
packing slips and port logs, stacked in loose piles sorted
with the same casual organization as the crates.  A locked
door in the back of office bears a sign reading Private.

32168.name: Office of the Head of Magical Affairs

32147.name: {wC{Wourtroom {wat {wT{Whe {wW{Waiting{x
description: The old Phlanarian courtroom looks much as it did when it
was used over a century ago.  The careful work of the Tyran
priesthood has left a beautifully restored oak-paneled room
with raised benches for the judges and finely polished pews
for the patrons.  A podium stands before the judges' stand,
allowing a proper forum for one to plead their case. On the
wall behind the judges' dais hangs a grand tapestry showing
the Blind God in battered armor, his blank stare gazing out
over the courtroom, a vigilant reminder that he watches all
the proceedings heard here and that justice will be served.

32185.name: {RI{rnn {RR{room {xat the {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin{x
description: A large four-poster bed with {Re{rlegan{Rt{x crimson bedding rests
against the eastern wall, welcoming guests to take a relaxing
nap.  Two thickly cushioned scarlet armchairs surround a long
mahogany table with stretches along the southern wall beneath
two {cw{Ci{Wn{wd{Wo{Cw{cs{x that look out on the busy docks.   Sheer curtains
and heavy scarlet drapes are hung upon the windows as well as
above the sliding glass door to the west which leads out onto
the {yb{walcon{yy{x. The gentle light of red {Rc{ra{yn{Yd{yl{re{Rs{x set in cast iron
candelabras fills the room with a warm ambience. The noise of
the tavern below and the city outside are hardly even audible
from the comforts of this fine room.

32116.name: {YK{*uto's {YW{*ell {YR{*oad{x
description: (Ernst's Livery to the north, Denelor's Tower to the west.)

32184.name: {BI{bnn {BR{boom {xat the {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin{x
description: A beautiful mahogany scroll bed rests against the center of
the western wall, clothed in {Br{bega{Bl{x blue bedding.  Pillows are
stacked at the head of the bed and a couple rest on the chair
by the {cw{Ci{Wn{wd{Wo{Cw{cs{x.  Two windows look out over the beautiful city
of Phlan, each draped in two layers of curtains:  sheer white
to let in the sun  and thick midnight blue for total privacy.
Beneath the windows, next to the armchair, a table crafted of
finest mahogany holds {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin {*s{wt{Watione{wr{*y{x  and a quill
and inkwell.  The view of the city is marvelous to the right,
peeking around the city hall building  which takes up much of
the view to the left.   Even the {*B{warren {*R{wiver{x and old {RV{raljevo
{RC{rastle{x can be seen to the east beyond Tyr's Temple.

32196.name: Sokol Keep Entrance Hall
description: (Use for: Sokol Keep/Thorn Island)

32135.name: {yC{gockburn's {yG{grocery{x
description: This store is a maze of crates and boxes and shelves, all
loosely organized perhaps by color or texture,  as no other
discernable pattern is obvious.  The crates are filled with
the staples most need,  be they city-dweller or adventurer.
Dried meats, fresh fruits and vegetables, some cookware all
fill the front of the store, while toward the back are some
fresh cheeses, milk, a small selection of fresh meats and a
counter with a scales and brown wrapping paper.  There is a
small sign with thick black letters upon the countertop. It
would be easy to miss among all the clutter.
| {*BEWARE Valhingen Graveyard!{x |
| {*20 persons missing in seven{x |
| {*years. Don't let your loved{x |
| {*       ones be next!       {x |
| {*In Memoriam: Rita Cockburn.{x |

32100.name: {yWestern {yWalk{x
description: This broad dirt road seems to get a decent bit of traffic,
connecting Scholars' Square to the south with the industrial
sector to the north. Dominating the western side of the road
are dormitories and cheap housing for the scholarly folk who
frequent Mantor's Library and its vicinity.   The wall which
surrounds the city rises up beyond those buildings, right at
the edge of Phlan Bay. A shop is nearby to the east, strange
gems sparkling in its side windows; the door would likely be
around south.  Looking north, the Cadorna Textile House sits
on the far horizon, just barely visible.

32153.name: {wT{Wyran {wW{Way{x
description: Tyran way bends here, stretching south to the docks and
east toward {WT{whe {WW{waiting{x. Directly north stands {BC{bity {BH{ball{x,
its doors always open to the public.   The windows facing
the street either look in  on offices or are concealed by
rather plain curtains. The old building to the west seems
to have been slathered in a fresh coat of paint recently.
A sign above its door reads {WN{*ew {BP{bhlan {WI{8nformation {WH{8ouse{x.
| {GT{goday's {YC{yracked {YC{yrown {GM{genu  {*|
| {xA Foie Gras Parfait         {*|
|  {xwith roasted hazelnuts     {*|
| {xVeal Picatta with           {*|
|  {xwhite wine, lemon & capers {*|
| {xCreme Brulee                {*|
|  {xwith chocolate wafers      {*|
| {xWe recommend a fine {rMerlot  {*|
|  {xto accompany your meal.    {*|

32122.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: One of Phlan's finer establishments stands to the east of
this stretch of Moonsea Road.  Its painted walls--a subdued
forest green--and front step are kept clean.  No sign hangs
upon the building,  but a bronze crown above the door marks
it as the {YC{yracked {YC{yrown{x.  The building to the north, purely
practical, presents an odd contrast to such elegance.  Just
a short distance southwest is the site of the famous {YK{Duto's{x
{YW{Dell{x; while to the southeast the equally infamous {rT{Draitor's{x
{rB{Dridge{x crosses the Barren River.

32150.name: {wB{Wishop {wS{Wtimpiir's {wO{Wffice{x
description: This office seems rather plain.  Its walls are bare, save
for a holy symbol of Tyr and the Bishop's credentials.  The
back wall has a small window which looks across an alley at
the Bitter Blade tavern. The sturdy wood desk in the middle
of the room is covered in short, neat stacks of paper.  Two
cushioned chairs sit in front of it, another behind it. The
eastern wall holds a door which is almost always closed and
locked.  The southern door leads back into The Waiting.

32134.name: {yN{worthwest {yC{worner {xof the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x
description: The smell of fresh citrus and breads waft into the area
from the west entering this corner of the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x from old
{yC{gockburn's {yG{grocery{x.  Citizens of the city pass in and out
of the sturdy building gathering their daily meals, quite
unnoticed by the patrons of the Bazaar, many of which are
tourists.   It is fairly likely that they've just drifted
in from the north,  where {YK{*uto's {YW{*ell {YR{*oad{x leads directly
to the well itself, an important historic landmark. Other
shops, as well as {MS{ccholar's {MS{cquare{x can be found that way.
The other directions seem little more than a continuation
of the grand maze of carts, stalls and tents that make up
the daily Bazaar.

32181.name: {xThe {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin {GI{gnn{x
description: Seldom does the large main room of the {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin{x get
a moment of quiet as its tables are always filled with loud,
raucous folk drinking to their hearts' content.  In spite of
the noise, the crowd seems good-natured, sharing stories and
laughs with one another.  Past the tables, a large horseshoe
shaped {ybar{x protrudes from the western wall. A wide selection
of liquor is displayed behind it,  but most seem to stick to
the ale. Sometimes, the upright {Wp{*i{Wa{*n{Wo{x by the northern window
delights the room with bright music played at the fingers of
one of the tavern's patrons or its dwarven owner. Beyond the
boisterous bar crowd, a swinging door leads to a back room.

32170.name: Office of the Head of Workers Affairs

32187.name: {MF{mairuza{M'{ms {MF{mlying {MF{melines{x
description: This shop is surprisingly small, made to seem smaller by the
large number of winged felines perched all about. The scent of
{Gc{gatni{Gp{x lingers in the air,  radiating from a rather tall plant
to the right of the door.  A few of the strange {Ww{Ci{Wng{Ce{Wd{x kitties
nibble on the leaves while others lounge about in soft pillows
lined up on {*s{yhelve{*s{x that  span the eastern and northern walls.
A wooden counter stretches the length of the western wall with
stuffed mice, collars, and other cat accessories covering it.

32198.name: Sokol Keep Courtyard
description: (Barracks etc to the north, granary/smithy to the east, etc.)

32182.name: {xThe {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin {GI{gnn{x
description: Though the clamor of the bar room can still be heard, this
room is far {*q{wu{Wiet{we{*r{x.  A few patrons sit at neatly set tables
eating their meals and talking amongst themselves.   Without
the distraction of the crowd, it is easier to get a feel for
the age of this building.  Its {ywo{*o{yd{x-{ypan{we{yl{x {yw{*al{yls{x seem to have
been patched several times, many boards varying in color and
age.  Still, the tavern offers a respectable and comfortable
atmosphere, magnified in the dining hall by its homey decor.
The many {cw{Ci{Wn{wd{Wo{Cw{cs{x look out on the docks, offering a fine view
during daylight. In the evening, the room is softly lit with
candlelight.  A set of {ys{*t{yai{*r{ys{x leads up to the inn rooms, and
a door marked "Employees Only" leads into the kitchen.

32194.name: Thorn Island Beacon
description: (gate mob here.  military docks to the south, off limits.)

32180.name: Sokol Keep Tours
description: A sturdy old desk sits in the middle of the small office of
Sokol Keep Tours. A faded {yp{*a{wi{cnt{wi{*n{yg{x of the old keep in all its
glory hangs on the beige wall behind the desk. A couple cases
display various artifacts dating back a couple hundred years.
A few dusty information pamphlets and a {Ws{wig{Wn{x are on the desk.
The whole room seems rather drab and unimpressive, save for a
bright smile beaming from the secretary behind the desk.  She
offers visitors tickets to Thorn Island to see Sokol Keep.
Due to the recent appropriation of Sokol Keep
by the Phlanarian Navy, tours are now limited
to the courtyard and chapel. We hope you will
feel as we do that Thorn Island is still well
worth a visit.  We have lowered our prices to
reflect this change.       Thank you!

32191.name: (Unused)
description: (Use for: Sokol Keep/Thorn Island)

32149.name: {wT{Whe {wW{Waiting's {wT{Wreasury{x
description: Boxes, safes and shelves bear the wealth of Tyr's church.
Arms and armor and tomes all are stacked in this small back
room which houses the  savings the church has amassed while
it has waited a long time, planning to reclaim the original
temple, now run by priests of Bane. It is a fine horde, but
far from large enough to quash so strong an enemy, one that
has woven itself into Phlan's society.  So the church waits
as their weapons grow dull and dusty.  Still, should anyone
need to equip in Tyr's name, they'd find sufficient weapons
and funds here.

32176.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: Commotion can be heard from all directions.  To the west,
the famed {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin {GI{gnn{x bustles with activity. On the
opposite side of the road,  the doors of the local training
hall swing open as warriors of all shapes and sizes come to
test their might in its {Ra{rr{Re{rn{Ra{x.  The passenger docks where a
visitor may book passage to Thorn Island lies to the south,
while to the north, tourists and locals alike hurry through
the busy intersection near {WT{wyr's {WT{wemple{x and City Hall.

32126.name: {rT{*raitor's {rG{*ate{x
description: (Gate before Drawbridge to Bane's Black Gardens.  Plaque telling the
story of Porphyrys Cadorna's betrayal?)

32197.name: Sokol Keep Gift Shop
description: (Use for: Sokol Keep/Thorn Island)

32179.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: The southern end of Moonsea Road looks out over the lovely
{CB{cay {xof {CP{chlan{x.   Ships move in and out of the passenger docks
throughout the day.  A large ferry with the words {RS{rokol {RK{reep
{RT{rours{x painted on the bow comes and goes at regular intervals
carrying visitors to and from {YT{yhorn {YI{ysland{x. Tickets are sold
in the office to the east.  To the west,  much merriment can
be heard from the best inn in the city, The Laughing Goblin.
The great expanse of the city  stretches northward along the
worn cobblestones of {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x.

32102.name: {YS{ycholars' {YS{yquare{x
description: Elegant shops and scholastic establishments line Scholars'
Square.  The two most notable on this stretch of cobblestone
road are the lapidary to the north and the famous library to
the south. From here, one can barely peer across the library
lawn to peek in the tall windows,  but even at this distance
it is easy to see the rows of neatly arranged books.  A sign
blows in the breeze above the shop door to the north.  A gem
is painted upon it between the words Beholder's Eye. Rows of
glittering jewels arranged in  velvet display cases look out
on the square through a crystal clear window. The road seems
to end to the west, becoming more residential, but continues
to the east, through the square and toward Kuto's Well Road.

32101.name: {YS{ycholars' {YS{yquare{x
description: The finely rounded and worn cobblestones of the square end
here, giving way to a large dirt road to the north and a few
smaller paths to the west leading to private residences.  To
the east all the bustle of wizardly and artistic life can be
found within Scholars' Square,  Phlan's center of knowledge,
art, and magic.   Some shops can be seen lining the northern
walk while to the south stands Mantor's Library, a structure
of grand proportion and age. The restored library is home to
a rather fine collection of texts and acts as the hub of the
educated quarter.  The road leading north, in contrast, is a
dusty and dirty path running  parallel to the city's western
well and ending in the industrial sector.

32104.name: {YS{ycholars' {YS{yquare{x
description: The northern corner of Scholars'  Square is set beteween a
music store and the famous Denelor's Tower. Many instruments
line the shop window, from mundane to exotic.  A sign before
them reads "Specializing in Bardic Instruments" but the sign
above the door declares the establishment  the Bearded Bard.
Even from behind, Denelor's Tower is rather impressive. It's
rather obviously the oldest  and tallest structure in Phlan.
The cobblestone road winding through this sector of the city
leads west toward more shops and residential areas and south
toward famed Mantor's Library and the small bookstore run by
the librarian and his twin brother.

32192.name: (Unused)
description: (Use for: Sokol Keep/Thorn Island)

32120.name: {YK{*uto's {YW{*ell{x
description: (Important Historical Site.  Well-guarded at all times.  Leads into tunnels.)
(No tunnels.  Not enough vnums :( )

32173.name: {xThe {gF{yishery{x
description: Several wooden {ystalls{x and tables line the walls of the
shop, each containing a stack of fish, most of which has
been brought in  just this morning from the Bay and from
the Moonsea. The smell of the fish is barely noticeable,
a good sign that the fish is very {cf{Cr{We{Cs{ch{x. A roll of thick
paper sits on the counter  in the back of the shop where
the fishmonger wraps up the {gs{yeafoo{gd{x for his customers. A
small hand-written has been set before each pile of fish
denoting its variety: catfish, flounder, swordfish, cod,
trout, salmon, tuna, and a few others.

32128.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: Those traveling this span of {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x would be unable
to ignore the tall, proud temple to the east.  Tall crystal
spires stretch to the sky, set into the white marble of the
building. Golden accents glitter in the light, most obvious
of which is a plague above the door, designating the temple
the {cC{Ch{Wap{Ce{cl {xof {YR{Ra{rd{yia{rn{Rc{Ye{x, devoted church of Sune Firehair. To
the west stands another stone building, this one a bit more
rough-hewn. Sounds of metal banging against metal ring from
its walls frequently.  Southward along Moonsea Road, one is
bound to pass by, if not through, the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x.  To the north
stands {rT{*raitor's {rB{*ridge{x and Kuto's Well, two famed historic
landmarks important to Phlan's history.

32145.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x and {wT{Wyran {wW{Way{x
description: The intersection of Moonsea Road and Tyran Way is certainly
one of the busiest junctions in Phlan,  sitting admist two of
the city's most important buildings as well as its most loved
tavern.  {wT{Whe {wW{Waiting{x, Tyr's most recent temple established in
Phlan, resides in the old courthouse which has been renovated
to accomodate the priesthood.  The welcoming doors are to the
east, open to all. To the northwest stands {BC{bity {BH{ball{x; the two
story establishment is one of the oldest in the city.  South,
the passenger docks and the Laughing Goblin bustle with life,
while to the north lies the main shopping district.

32144.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: The most notable feature along this piece of Moonsea Road
is {wT{Wyr's {wT{Wemple{x to the east and its magnificent {ym{wu{Wr{wa{yl{x.  The
whole mural is too large to see in its entirity from such a
close perspective.  Still, one can gather quite easily that
it depicts the monumental event in which {wT{Wyr{x lost his right
hand to the {MC{mh{*a{mo{Ms {*H{go{Gu{gn{*d{x. In this half of the grand painting
{wT{Wyr{x stands, a bearded warrior dressed in light armor, sword
held in his left hand.   His face is both stern and loving,
like that of a father making {Rs{ra{*c{wr{Wi{wf{*i{rc{Re{x for his children. He
holds his right hand out to Kezef, steady between the teeth
which are poised to feast on his flesh.

32151.name: {wT{Whe {wW{Waiting{x
description: The wide oaken hallway of Tyr's Temple leads from the old
courtroom back to the more  religious areas of The Waiting.
To the east, a wide arched doorway remains open most hours,
its double doors pulled aside  to allow clergy and visitors
alike to worship Tyr in a more traditional setting.  To the
north is another door, upon which hangs a small sign noting
that this is the office of Bishop Holondos Stimpiir.  There
are no windows in this hallway as the stone wall outside is
painted in a grand mural.  Some light, however, shines from
the brass lanterns hung on the walls.

32130.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: Roaming this section of Moonsea Road, the occasional meow
can be heard from the shop to the east  over the bustle and
noise of the {yb{*a{wza{*a{yr{x to the west.  As long as the sun is up,
the bazaar is full of life and activity, merchants of every
variety selling their wares to passersby. Sweet smells from
the various food vendors fill the air.  The eastern windows
look in on a shop filled with  napping and playing cat-like
creatures. The sign above the door swings in the wind. Upon
it is painted an elegant black cat sitting regally with its
white wings held high. Beside the winged cat are the words,
painted in cursive lettering: {MF{mairuza{M'{ms {MF{mlying {MF{melines{x.

32193.name: Thorn Island Docks
description: (Use for: Sokol Keep/Thorn Island)

32103.name: {gB{Ge{Ch{Yol{Cd{Ge{gr{c'{gs {GE{Yy{Ce{x
description: A little silver bell above the door jingles when customers
enter or exit this little shop, drawing the attention of the
aged dwarf behind the marble-topped counter. Finely engraved
scrollwork lines the edges of cool white marble,  upon which
rest several small glass cases glittering in the candlelight
flickering about the shop. Inside the cases, stones of every
shape and size bear price tags for every budget. Most of the
stones are not set in any sort of jewelry,  but could easily
be fitted.  When not dealing with customers, the shopkeeper,
Deryk Stoneshaper, is patiently cutting and polishing gems.

32165.name: Office of the Head of Residential Affairs
description: (Make this guy our Banite Councilman?)

32105.name: The Bearded Bard
description: One of the most interesting and popular shops in Phlan, the
Bearded Bard is also one of the newest.  Nearly always, music
rings through the store, either from patrons trying out their
purchases or the owner Bertram Bellwhistle playing a song for
his customers. Bertram has traveled much of the realms and is
gaining a reputation, now that he's settled in Phlan, for his
fine tale-telling and magnificent playing. Many of his unique
instruments have been gathered during his travels, but almost
all of the store's wares have  been carved with Bertram's own
hands. A few flutes and horns and lutes of various shapes and
sizes are arranged in the front window which looks out on the
lovely Scholars' Square.
{*[{YO{ypen{Y: {C6{cam  {YC{ylose{Y: {C8{cpm{*]{x

32125.name: {*S{Wwo{*r{wd{*h{Wal{*l{x
description: (Add another room for Tempus' Armory.  They so need an armory.)

32156.name: {BM{bayor's {BO{bffice{x
description: (Have a guard or treasurer or some such to carry the vault key?)

32172.name: {wT{Wyran {wW{Way{x
description: A slight aroma of fresh fish wafts from the building to
the west, the door hanging slightly open.   Carved on its
old wooden door is the word {gF{yishery{x.  A deep voice inside
sings a strange fisherman's ditty. Windows peek in on the
{GL{gaughing {GG{goblin{x to the east, its tavern full of activity.
The commercial docks and the {WP{*ortmaster's {WO{*ffice{x both are
to the south along Tyran Way, while City Hall is directly
north, at which point the road seems to bend to the east.

32106.name: {YS{ycholars' {YS{yquare{x
description: The southern corner of Scholars' Square is nestled between
the renowned Mantor's Library and Brothers Aspermere Books &
Maps which is owned and operated by the librarian Pontus and
his twin brother Pius.  The grand library building stands to
the west.  It has clearly undergone renovation recently, its
stonework finely polished, its wood still looking fresh.  An
enormous set of double doors mark the entrance,  above which
are carved the words "Nam et ipsa scientia potestas est." In
the shop window,  a map of the Moonsea region is prominently
displayed among several books on local geography and legend.
To the north, Scholar's Square  continues with more shops of
esoteric interests, and to the east lies Kuto's Well.
"For knowledge itself is power."   - Sir Francis Bacon

32166.name: Office of the Head of Tourism

description: -=) Bargain Moonblades (=-

32174.name: {wT{Wyran {wW{Way{x
description: The commotion of the commercial docks along the Bay of
Phlan buzzes southward along {wT{Wyran {wW{Way{x during most hours
of the day and often into the late evening.   Warehouses
by the dozen line the southern docks.  A shaky old, sea-
worn building stands to the west, bearing a sign for the
{WP{*ortmaster{x next to its rusty-hinged door.   The building
to the east looks nearly as old, but in better repain. A
second story balcony looks out from the {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin{x,
while first floor windows peek in on the dining hall. To
the north, {wT{Wyran {wW{Way{x continues to City Hall.

32152.name: {wT{Wyran {wW{Way{x
description: This section of Tyran Way is sandwiched between {BC{bity {BH{ball{x
and the {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin {GI{gnn{x.  The windows on the old wooden
building to the south look in on much merriment and revelry
while the windows to the north look in on the quiet offices
of city councilmen.  Looking to the east, one can see Tyr's
Temple in all its glory. Painted on the side of {wT{Whe {wW{Waiting{x
is a grand {ymural{x honoring the Just God as he sacrificed his
own right hand to save all from Kezef's unrelenting hunger.

32183.name: {xThe {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin {GI{gnn{x
description: The upstairs of the inn bears the same hardwood floors and
paneled walls, but a fine imported carpet covers much of the
hallway.  Against the eastern wall is a small desk with some
papers and a guest log book sprawled on its surface.  A {*sign{x
hangs behind the desk giving the rates for a stay at the inn
in one of its {Ml{movel{My r{moom{Ms{x. To either side of the sign hangs
a painting: the left capturing the beautiful Bay of Phlan as
it may have looked a long time ago, its waters crystal blue;
the right depicting the {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin{x from the outside, as
it may have looked decades ago. At either end of the hall is
a door leading to one of the inn rooms.
{*| {GL{gaughing {GG{goblin {GI{gnn {BN{bightly {BR{bates {*|
{*| {GR{goom {G1{g: {xQueen-size bed    {y75 {Ygold {*|
{*| {GR{goom {G2{g: {xKing-size bed,            {*|
{*|         {xwith balcony     {y100 {Ygold {*|

32160.name: Office of the Head of Commercial Affairs

32138.name: {yS{woutheast {yC{worner {xof the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x
description: Wandering through the dizzying maze of tents, stalls, and
booths that make up the {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x, one could quickly get lost.
The smells of sweet breads and confections drift in from an
indiscernable direction.   The sounds of coins being passed
and deals being made fills every corner of the bazaar. Mats
and tables and carts are covered with {Wt{wri{*nk{wet{Ws{x and rarities
of all sorts.   The selection of people wandering this part
of the city is just as wide:  the working class looking for
cheap goods; the affluent and influential seeking stranger,
less common items.  The {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x has pushed itself right upto
the back of the City Hall  building with its draped windows
to the south.  {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x lies to the east, and {YJ{ye{*rro{ym{Ye{y's{x
waits right across the street, doing fair business.

32139.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: This section of the beautiful Moonsea Road is bordered on
the west by the constant commotion of the city's {yB{*a{wza{*a{yr{x.  A
broad array of smells and sounds fill the air. To the east,
a shop with broad display {Ww{window{Ws{x, filled with many strange
items, attracts both respectable and shadier clientelle.  A
sign shaped into a thick disk and painted gold,  resembling
a coin, hangs above the door, swaying in the sea breeze. It
reads {YJ{ye{*rro{ym{Ye{y's {xof {cM{welvaunt{x  and gives little indication of
the store's nature.  The docks and the governmental offices
are to the south.  More shops and the famed {YK{*uto's {YW{*ell{x lie
to the north.

32127.name: {rT{*raitor's {rB{*ridge{x
description: (Link to Bane's Black Gardens)

32124.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: A sturdy building, clearly built for function rather than
aesthetic, stands on the eastern side of the road, its back
to the {*B{barren {*R{biver{x. Upon its door hangs an old shortsword,
its blade battered and knicked from seemingly many years of
use.  It seems, however, freshly polished.  The wood behind
it has been painted, yellow flame upon a red shield.  Above
the sword's point at the top of the shield, a bronze plaque
declares this building {*S{Wwo{*r{wd{*h{Wal{*l{x, Temple of Tempus.  To the
north, Podol Plaza can be glanced in the distance, while to
the south, tourists pass by famous landmarks such as {YK{*uto's
{YW{*ell{x.  A wooden building, stables by the smell and sound of
it, stands to the west, reeking faintly of horse droppings.

32140.name: {YJ{ye{*rro{ym{Ye{y's {xof {cM{welvaunt{x
description: Every manner of item rests upon the shelves of this shop.
From trinkets and heirlooms to kitchenry and weaponry, that
which can be bought and sold  is {ybought {xand {Ysold{x right here
at {YJ{ye{*rro{ym{Ye{y's{x.  Rumor has it, though it's not spoken loudly,
that whatever you want,  Jerrome can get--for a price and a
little time, of course. {*M{wi{Wrro{wr{*s{x are hung in all the corners
of the shop, allowing Jerrome full view of his merchandise,
and of any potential shop-lifters.   Though the place seems
dimly lit, the owner's eyes seem to catch everything.  This
is most definitely a {Yp{yawn sho{Yp{x.

32162.name: Office of the Head of Foreign Affairs

32195.name: Before Sokol Keep
description: (Use for: Sokol Keep/Thorn Island)

32186.name: {YB{yalcony {xoverlooking the {CB{cay {xof {CP{chlan{x
description: Sturdy {*iron{x railings line the balcony overlooking the bay.
The floor is solid, but shows the wear and weathering it has
taken over time. Surprisingly spacious, the balcony fits two
people quite comfortably. A deep red chaise lounge sits near
the door, looking quite comfortable. The {Yv{yie{Yw{x is spectacular
from here.  To the right stretches the whole city, while the
{CB{cay {xof {CP{chlan{x can be seen clearly straight ahead.  The waters
of the bay glisten in daylight as well as moonlight.  In the
center of the bay floats {YT{yhorn {YI{ysland{x,  upon its surface the
ruins of the once strong Sokol Keep.

32133.name: {RM{wa{Wth{we{*o{x's
description: The front of this large stone building is well lit with a
few copper lanterns hanging from the walls among the wooden
racks.  Held on the many racks,  a decent variety of blades
display the excellent quality of Matheo's work. Adventurers
and warriors come from around the Moonsea region  solely to
purchase Matheo's weapons. Past the wooden table which acts
as the sales counter is the forge where Matheo works. It is
unbearably hot back there even though the rest of the store
is kept reasonably cool by the stone structure.   Customers
are welcome to look at the weapons,  removing them from the
racks upon which they rest, but warning signs are posted by
each rack reading: {*You {Rblood {*it, you {Ybuy {*it{x.

32142.name: The {BB{cit{wte{Wr {wBl{cad{Be{x
description: Salt, seafood, and smoke fill the small tavern with an odd
though not entirely unappealing aromatic ambience.   Several
round wooden tables, looking a bit worse for wear, fill most
of the dimly lit room.  A few square {ytables{x are pushed right
against the eastern wall.  To the left, when one enters, the
bar stretches nearly the full length of the tavern,  curling
at the end to leave room for passage to the store rooms.  An
old {*s{who{Wrtsw{wor{*d{x, rusted by the sea air, hangs behind the bar,
its blade pointing north.  A strange statue of a {gm{Ge{Wr{wm{Wa{Gi{gd{x has
been tucked in the southwestern corner and forgotten, easily
overlooked by the patrons, most of whom are sailors who have
likely seen their fair share of the temptresses.

32148.name: {wT{Whe {wW{Waiting{x
description: Beyond the broad arch lay the primary worship area of The
Waiting.  Well-polished wooden pews line either side of the
wide walk to the pulpit. Hooded brass lanterns hang on both
side walls, offering a warm light. Behind the large pulpit,
a large paneled window looks out over the Barren River.  An
altar of finely polished grey  granite rises from the dais.
Upon its face has been chiseled and painted Try's symbol, a
set of golden scales upon a golden hammer. By the door sits
a small brass collection place for donations and tithes.

32137.name: {yN{*at {yW{*yler's {yB{*ell{x
description: A stench of cheap ale and stale smoke seems to have sunk
right into the wood,  becoming a permanent fixture of this
small inn.  Tables are scattered about the room; a few are
surrounded by drunken patrons,  caught up in conversation.
Along the back wall is an old bar, behind which are a pair
of odd items. The first is a platform raised a couple feet
from the ground, stretching the length of the bar,  making
bartending a bit easier for the gnomish barkeep. The other
is a bit more extraordinary: it is Nat Wyler himself, dead
twenty years or more now, hold a large bronze bell.  There
is a wobbly wooden staircase leading to the common room on
the second floor, a free stay gladly given with sufficient
purchase of the bar's bland food and cheap ale.

32190.name: (Unused)
description: (Use for: Sokol Keep/Thorn Island)

32121.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: This stretch of Moonsea Road  stands directly between two
of Phlan's most famous landmarks: {YK{Duto's {YW{Dell {xand {rT{Draitor's{x
{rG{Date{x.  At least one well-armed guard stands to the west and
keeps guard over the well at all times. To the east, no one
guards the gate over the {DBarren River{x and few citizens make
use of it. On the other side lies a temple to Bane, gardens
full of poisonous plants surrounding it.  To the southeast,
the tall crystalline spires of the {cC{Ch{Wap{Ce{cl {xof {YR{Ra{rd{yia{rn{Rc{Ye{x stand
proud.  To the northeast, an elegant green building with an
old cracked crown above the door sees little business.

32146.name: {wE{Wntrance {wto T{Whe {wW{Waiting{x
description: A fine old building, the walls and floors of The Waiting
are solid oak. A small waiting area rests right inside the
door, a few crimson padded seats ordered neatly around the
room. A southern window streams in sunlight during midday.
Across from the entrance is  a solid oak door opening into
the old courtroom,  preserved to this day in this house of
justice.  The traditional Tyran symbol of golden scales on
top of a golden hammer hangs on the door. A few priests go
about their priestly duties and help guide visitors to the
proper rooms. To the north one will find a better place to
worship Tyr as well as the church's offices.

32143.name: {CM{coonsea {CR{coad{x
description: Travelling this stretch of Moonsea Road, one can not help
but notice the large, vibrantly painted {ym{wu{Wr{wa{yl{x covering most
of the building to the east.   The windowless side of {wT{Wyr's{x
{wT{Wemple{x depicts a scene so large  it is difficult to take in
from this perspective. The whole of the mural recreates {wT{Wyr{x
sacrificing his hand to {*K{ge{Gz{ge{*f{x for the safety of mortals and
gods alike. Pictured here is the Chaos Hound, his grotesque
maggot-infested body shown in horrific detail. He stands on
his hind paws as a {Yc{yhai{Yn{x binds his bulk.  Between his razor
sharp teeth {wT{Wyr{x holds his right hand as a show of {Whonor{x.

32129.name: Charis Zayn~
description:
Hair the color of sunlight on a summer day hangs
casually to his waist, kept tied neatly behind a
pair of delicately pointed ears.  His crystaline
blue eyes dance along the curves of his feminine
patrons.  Full of pride,  he keeps his head high
whether he's flirting or looking down upon those
too unattractive to enter Sune's radiant chapel.
32129.d_flags: D CRIES, '{CA tragedy that the realms should lose a face beautiful as mine!{c'{x~
32129.room_name: The handsome Sunite Charis Zayn flirts with his female congregation.

32133.name: Matheo~
description:
Matheo seems unusually tall for an elf, but his
elegantly defined features  and sharply pointed
ears verify his true elven nature.  He wears an
old leather smock over a pair of breeches and a
bare chest. His muscles are sinewy and his skin
is slick with sweat.  He wears his long reddish
black hair pulled back, shaved on the sides, to
create the effect of a long mohawk.
32133.room_name: A rather large elf sits polishing a sharp blade.  This must be Matheo.

32135.name: Mr. Cockburn~
description:
Mr. Cockburn seems to be a pleasant man, running
his shop with a broad--perhaps too broad--smile.
He wears a pair of thick  spectacles and a faded
faded green smock.  He appears to be in his mid-
fifties, white hair just touching his ears.
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
32135.room_name: Mr. Cockburn offers a kind word to all his customers.

32137.name: Gnahac Gnarlnose~
description:
A mischievous gnome named Gnahac Gnarlnose is the 
current owner of the inn called Nat Wyler's Bell. 
His eyes are so deep green they seem nearly black 
in most light. In spite of his crooked and toothy 
grin he seems honest enough, giving his customers 
exactly what they pay for.
32137.room_name: Gnahac Gnarlnose stands behind the bar with old Nat Wyler.

32140.name: Jerrome~
description:
Jerrome wears the confident grin of a man who 
knows he can do whatever he puts his mind to. 
In dealing with his customers, his dark brown 
eyes observe their manner as well as maintain 
steady watch on his wares.   He holds himself 
with a strange grace, seeming both deliberate 
and casual in his every movement.
32140.room_name: Jerrome greets his customers with a suave grin.

32142.name: Alrem Lorath~
description:
Alrem Lorath is a rough-faced man with stormy grey 
eyes.  He wears his grey hair slicked back and has 
a stubble of dark whiskers filling in his chin. He 
spends most of his time talking with sailors fresh 
into port from foreign cities,  getting a feel for 
the political situations around the realms.  He is 
also the Head of Foreign Affairs  and gathers much 
of his information working at the Bitter Blade.
32142.room_name: Alrem Lorath tends the bar, talking with a few sailors.

32146.name: a priest of {wT{Whe {wW{Waiting{x~
32146.room_name: A Tyran priest needs some details.

32147.name: a Tyran priest~
32147.room_name: A priest wanders the temple tending to his duties.

32150.name: Bishop Holondos Stimpiir~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK

32154.name: Nevon~
description:
A young man with neatly combed sandy hair
sits behind the City Hall reception desk.
He greets everyone with a friendly smile,
offering assistance to those who need it.
His clothing has been  perfectly pressed,
and his nails are meticulously manicured.
32154.room_name: A receptionist sits behind a large desk, filing his nails.

32173.name: Munus the Fishmonger~
description:
Munus is a stooped man with leathery skin.  His
hands are thick as is his sloppy black hair. He
often hums and sings to himself as he sorts and
stacks and slices and wraps  the assorted daily
catch.  He's by no means an attractive man, but
his smile is bright enough to make anyone smile
back, his blue eyes full of friendliness.
32173.room_name: Munus, Phlan's best Fishmonger, sings happily as he works.

32175.name: Falik Osteron~
description:
Falik Osteron is a dark-skinned human with deeply 
wrinkled skin.  He wears silver-rimmed spectacles 
with small circular bifocal lenses.  A faded blue 
cap often covers his bald scalp.  His fingers are 
long with thick, knotted knuckles, writing in his 
perfect script as he checks over his paperwork.
32175.room_name: The Portmaster, Falik Osteron, reviews transportation logs.  (Check my stats!)

32180.name: Talula~
description:
A red-headed ball of enthusiasm, Talula brightly greets
visitors and details some of the history of Sokol Keep.
Her clothing seems a bit tight,  clinging to her rather
curvacious figure.  Her voice is high-pitched but quite
friendly as she sells her ferry tickets.
32180.room_name: Talula offers a friendly smile and ferry tickets to visitors.

32181.name: Boradak Goblinkicker~
description:
Boradak is a bright-eyed, brown-skinned dwarf.  He moves
about the tavern with a large flagon of ale in his right
hand, his left gesturing as he speaks.  He's as rowdy as
anyone else, enjoying himself and his job enormously.
32181.room_name: Boradak Goblinkicker shares a few ales and stories with his customers.

32182.name: Myralie~
description:
The waitress, a tall human with brown hair and eyes, seems
to be in her early thirties.  She tends to all the patrons
in the dining room with a pleasant demeanor,  occasionally
offering one of the regulars a world-wise smirk, showing a
bit of hardness through her soft, rather attractive face.
32182.room_name: Myralie sits at a corner table reading when not serving customers.

32183.name: Timothea~
description:
A thin woman runs the reception desk, offering rooms
to those wishing to stay at the Laughing Goblin Inn.
Her pale orangish hair is pulled up into a tight bun
atop her head, little frizzes sticking out along her
hairline.  She wears a contented smile and rose-tint
to her cheeks. Perhaps she's had too much ale today.
32183.room_name: The innkeeper, Timothea, sits behind her desk sipping ale from a tall mug.

32187.name: {wF{*airuza{x~
description:
Unusually thin, even for an elf, Fairuza looks like she should
spend more time in the kitchen and less with her kittens.  Her
black clothing bears a thin layer of cat fur which goes easily
unnoticed at a distance.  She wears her raven-black hair short
cropped, framing her rather feline face nicely.  She rarely is
caught smiling, prefering to conduct business quite seriously.
32187.room_name: Fairuza sits behind her counter petting a pitch black fluttercat.

32188.name: a tabby {yf{*l{yu{*t{yte{*r{yc{*a{yt{x~
description:
Aside from its wings,  this creature looks much like any other
cat. Its fur is striped shades of orange and covers its wings.
32188.room_name: A fiesty orange tabby cat with furry wings flutters by its master.

32189.name: a grey {wf{Wl{*u{wtter{*c{Wa{wt{x~
description:
Aside from its wings, this creature looks much like any other
cat.   Its fur is short and grey and covers its strong wings.
32189.room_name: A grey fluttercat glances around, looking for mischief.

32190.name: a white angora {Wf{Cl{wu{Wtter{wc{Ca{Wt{x~
description:
Aside from its wings, this creature looks much like any other
cat. Its wings and body are covered in long, snowy white fur.
32190.room_name: A snow white cat with beautiful angelic wings purrs contentedly.

32191.name: a rare chocolate {rfl{yu{rtter{yc{rat{x~
description:
Aside from its wings, this creature looks much like any other
cat. Its wings, face, tail, and ears are covered in beautiful
dark brown fur, while its body is slightly lighter.  This cat
is indeed the rarest of variety of all fluttercats.
32191.room_name: A regal chocolate brown fluttercat looks about with disdain.

32192.name: a {*tressym{x~
description:
Aside from its wings, this creature looks much like any other
cat.  Its fur is short and black, its eyes piercing green.  A
pair of leathery,  bat-like wings stretch from its shoulders.
Feathers cover the membranous area between hollow wing bones.
32192.room_name: A bat-winged black cat hovers close to its master.

32100.name: (unused)~
32100.room_name: The Harbor Master stands here checking people for contraband.

32101.name: (unused)~
description:
Before you stands a tall human with a light build and of average
weight.  He bears angled features and a hawkish nose and dark grey
eyes.  He wears a leatherworkers smock, which basically is a leather
apron with pockets for tools over his soiled clothing and has grease
marks all over his face and hands.
32101.room_name: A leather worker stands here, making new armor.

32102.name: (unused)~
description:
Before you stands a well built human.  He stands a good 5 and a
half feet tall and has a well tone frame.  His muscle bulge from his
shirt which is soaked with sweat and grim from the furnace.  You see
coal debree mixing into the sweat on his chisled face.  As he sees you
walk in he smiles hopefully.
32102.room_name: Phlan's blacksmith stands here waiting to sell some of his wares.

32103.name: Deryk Stoneshaper~
description:
Deryk Stoneshaper has been a lifelong lapidary, a fact
evident in his perpetual squint.  His hands are thick,
yet steady as they work with the precious gems. He has
skin the color of freshly tanned leather and long hair
white as fresh snow, streaked now and again with ashen
strands.  All he does, he does with infinite patience.
32103.room_name: An aged dwarf works thoughtfully over some precious gems.

32104.name: (unused)~
description:
Before you stands a common man, who happens to be a citizen of
Phlan.  You can see scars disappearing under his woolen tunic, and his
eyes are heavy and sad; this is a man who has survived much.
32104.room_name: A citizen of Phlan goes about his daily business.

32105.name: Bertram Bellwhistle~
description:
The owner of the Bearded Bard is indeed bearded and most
certainly a bard even if he looks more like a barbarian.
Standing at a good 6'4" with broad shoulders and a thick
chest, Bertram intimidates many of his more meek patrons
who may not know he has a big heart to fit his big body.
All his hair is a pale bronze, including his beard which
hangs nearly to his waist tied neatly here and there.
32105.room_name: Bertram hums to himself as he arranges his instruments.

32106.name: (unused)~
description:
The mage is an older man, who specialized in use of magic to
protect the city.  He has sharp features and a long white beard
flowing down to cover part of his deep blue robes.  His eyes pierce
everything in front of him, critically examining everybody he sees for
signs of trouble.
32106.room_name: A Phlanarian mage patrols here with the city guard.

32107.name: Pius Aspermere~
description:
A tall, slender man with fine white hair, Pius 
Aspermere spends much of his day sorting books
and maps in his store. His brown eyes peer out
from behind a pair of  gold-rimmed spectacles.
His goatee and mustache are neatly trimmed. He
seems a bit fussier than his brother Pontus.
32107.room_name: Pius Aspermere is sorting through stacks of books and maps.

32108.name: Pontus Aspermere~
description:
A tall and slender man with mussed white hair,
Pontus Asperemere spends much time among these
shelves indexing and enjoying the old library.
His face is clean-shaven, but his skin bears a
few slight wrinkles.  His kind brown eyes seem
welcoming. He tends to be a bit more laid back
than his brother Pius who runs the bookshop.
32108.room_name: Pontus Aspermere sits at the librarian's desk reading a very large book.

32109.name: (unused)~
description:
Before you stands an average human of average features.  She has
flowing blond hair that goes with her sparkling blue eyes, and she
accents them by wearing a pale blue tunic.
32109.room_name: A female shopkeeper stands behind the counter.

32110.name: (unused)~
description:
Before you stands a human in his late years.  He is balding with
wisps of white hair apon his head.  You see that he has ashen eyes and
a grim look apon him.  He wears the standard robes of the Tyrian sect
and helps newcomers with their ailments.
32110.room_name: An aged priest stands here giving a sermon.

32111.name: (unused)~
description:
Before you stands the barkeep of one of the local establishments. 
He is rather rough looking, from being in so many bar fights, and is
apparantly rather strong to have survived them.  He wears a white
tunic with a brown smock over it so that he doesn't spill anything on
his clothing.
32111.room_name: A barkeep stands here waiting to serve you.

32112.name: (unused)~
description:
Before you stands a human with sharp features and pale skin.  She
stands a sapling and a half tall and bears a slight noble gate.  She
has long brown hair and has bright blue eyes, and her smile is warm
and sincere.
32112.room_name: A striking female stands behind the counter.

32113.name: Rowena~
description:
Rowena stands at about 5'6" and wears long mulberry
robes. Her thick chestnut hair cascades down to her
lower back in large curls.  Her beige complexion is
lightly freckled over her cheeks and nose, in spite
of her obvious age.  She is likely nearing forty or
so, but maintains a youthful smile,  tending to her
tower and its visitors cheerfully.
32113.room_name: The lovely wizardess Rowena encourages visitors to appreciate the tower's history.

32114.name: Aylaran~
description:
Aylaran is a slender elven woman with
hair of cornsilk and ocean blue eyes.
She wears fine silk clothing in pale,
earthy colors.  Though her hands give
no tell tale signs,  it is well-known
that she crafts much of her wares.
32114.room_name: Aylaran polishes some of her delightful silver wares.

32115.name: (unused)~
description:
A tall, thin man stands here in the robes of a cleric of Tyr.  His
face is hardened from fighting countless enemies at the gates of his
city and church.  His steel-gray eyes burrow into you, trying to
decide if you are a threat to be destroyed or a parishoner to be
welcomed.
32115.room_name: A cleric of Tyr stands at attention, guarding the Arch-Bishop.

32116.name: (unused)~
description:
The Archbishop of Tyr is a middle-aged man with a regal look.  He
wears the same robes as all of the other clerics of Tyr, but somehow
his seem to shine brighter, as if lit from the inside.  His face is
creased and weathered, but his smile is soft and welcoming.  His steel
gray eyes seem to look straight through you to your soul, where he
sifts through your depest secrets.
32116.room_name: The Archbishop of Tyr himself is studying the teachings.

32117.name: Ernst~
description:
Ernst is an aging man with an uneasy peace
about him. The top of his head is balding,
but the back is a  long and wild tangle of
brown hair kept  tied by a leather string.
His deep brown eyes  express a rare depth.
Around his neck, he wears Eldath's symbol.
32117.room_name: Ernst, an aging druid, tends to the horses in his charge.

32118.name: (unused)~
description:
A huge titan warrior with battle scars covering his exposed arms
works with the warriors in training.  "The city of Phlan needs its
warriors now more than ever," he says to his students, "you must learn
to be stronger than anything that can attack us."
32118.room_name: A huge titan warrior presides over the training in progress.

32119.name: (unused)~
description:
A woman who looks to be in her mid fourties patiently works with
the students in the room, showing them how to properly cast spells. 
Her brown hair is clipped short and curls around under her chin to
frame her tanned face.  Her robes are a deep, shimmering green.  When
you look at them, you can almost hear wind rustling through thick
treetops...
32119.room_name: A middle aged woman wearing flowing {Gg{gr{Ge{ge{Gn{0 robes supervises the students.

32120.name: A Well Guard~
description:
A tall man dressed in thick scale armor bearing
the Phlanarian city seal stands by Kuto's Well,
guarding it vigilantly. While his eyes may bear
dark lines beneath them, he remains attentive.
32120.room_name: A vigilant guard makes sure no one gets too close to the well.

32123.name: Robyrtah Greensash~
description:
Robyrtah Greensash is a woman full of confidence.
She walks with pride and  talks with a command of
the common tongue.  Her rusty brown hair has been
tucked into a neat bun. Little ringlets frame her
pleasant face.  There is something in her eyes to
lead someone to believe she's live a hard life.
32123.room_name: The proprietor, Robyrtah Greensash, takes time to personally see to her customers.

32125.name: Makhaira Fellsword~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
32125.room_name: The head priestess of Tempus' Temple, Mikhaira Fellsword, stands here in full armor.
